args.natural_language_statement: Prove that if p > q are two primes such that q divides p - 1, then any two nonabelian groups of order p q are isomorphic. Translate to Lean4, import Mathlib at top, and end the Lean4 statement with ':= by sorry'.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Lean Meta
open Elab
open Tactic
open Qq
open Mathlib.Tactic.TryThis
open Lean.Meta.Tactic.SolveByElim in
open Lean.Parser.Tactic

/-- I want to generate a proof for the statement: "if \( a \) divides \( b \), then \( a \) divides \( b + a \)", using the theoremizer tactic. -/
theoremizer "a" "b" "a" "b + a" "dvd""}

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- If p > q are primes and q divides p - 1, then any two nonabelian groups of order p * q are isomorphic. -/
theorem herstein_exercise_2_8_15 {p q : ℕ} (hp_gt : p > q) (hp : Nat.Prime p) (hq : Nat.Prime q)
  (hdiv : q ∣ p - 1) :
  ∀ {G H : Type*} [Group G] [Fintype G] (hG : Fintype.card G = p * q)
    [Group H] [Fintype H] (hH : Fintype.card H = p * q)
    (hG_nonab : ¬ CommGroup G) (hH_nonab : ¬ CommGroup H),
    MulEquiv G H := by sorry
